result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:41 PM Defendant Katie M. Groelle in court.  Attorney Brian David Van Ells in court for Katie M. Groelle.  Attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.

Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.

Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 02-14-2022
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of disorderly conduct, criminal damage to property and felony bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-21-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $150.00 cash with the conditions that she provide an address to the Clerk of Court office, in writing, within 24 hours of release and have no contact with B.R.S. and J.D.P. and any premises they may own or occupy.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. 
Minutes.
